item.title: Utah Wireless Broadband Drive Test
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: During November the Utah Broadband Project is having a consultant run a mobile broadband driving test: This November, Isotrope LLC, under contract with the Utah Broadband Project, will conduct a mobile drive test on 6,000 miles of roads in Utah. During the drive test, Isotrope will collect real-time mobile broadband wireless coverage and speed information. All […]
item.content:encoded:
During November the Utah Broadband Project is having a consultant run a mobile broadband driving test:

This November, Isotrope LLC, under contract with the Utah Broadband Project, will conduct a mobile drive test on 6,000 miles of roads in Utah. During the drive test, Isotrope will collect real-time mobile broadband wireless coverage and speed information. All mobile wireless broadband data over cellular, PCS, LTE, and IDEN frequencies and protocols will be collected.

The drive test map is hard to zoom in on, but it does look like the proposed route comes with in just a block or two of my house. I’m curious to see what the results show in terms of signal strength from the major wireless providers.

item.title: Links for Tue 1 Jan 2008
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Hackszine.com: Eavesdropping on Bluetooth headsets – I wish I could say that I’m surprised by this, but I’m not. With so many Bluetooth headsets already out there that are subject to this it is unlikely that we’ll be safe anytime soon, even if this was fixed today. Tags: bluetooth security wireless headset mobile
item.content:encoded:
• Hackszine.com: Eavesdropping on Bluetooth headsets – I wish I could say that I’m surprised by this, but I’m not. With so many Bluetooth headsets already out there that are subject to this it is unlikely that we’ll be safe anytime soon, even if this was fixed today.
    Tags: bluetooth security wireless headset mobile
